alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 11:18AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Fox River at Dayton affecting La Salle County. For the Fox River (Illinois)...including Dayton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Fox River from Millington downstream to the confluence with the Illinois River, including the Dayton gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, multiple structures may be threatened north of Sheridan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Saturday, river gauge data indicated an ongoing ice jam near Dayton. - Forecast...Flooding is expected to continue near and upstream of the ice jam while it remains in place. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: An ice jam is likely affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during periods of heavy river ice cover and ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 530 AM CST.
